item.title: THE XREPORT | Week of 05/08/2022
item.description:
View this email in your browser
THE XREPORT
May 8, 2022

THIS WEEK'S TOPICS

New Leadership Announcements | XR Club's Exhibits at Innovate Maryland Expo | NASA MarsXR Challenge: Call for Members
XR Club Members at Reality Night!

XR CLUB NEWS AND EVENTS

LAST WEEK RECAP
Last Tuesday, we hosted our Where to Go From Here workshop, where we presented attendees a high-level overview of various XR-related topics we didn't get the chance to cover this semester. Also, we hosted our final showcase and celebration of the semester: Reality Night! Members were able to check out some of the cool XR projects that XR Club members have been working on throughout the semester as we recognized some of some notable members of the club as well as our graduating seniors. Thanks to everyone who stopped by. We hope everyone had an amazing time this semester! Good luck to everyone during finals, and we encourage you all to continue to expand your XR skills this summer. 
 

XR CLUB LEADERSHIP ANNOUNCEMENT
XR Club is excited to announce that D.J. Figueroa will be the new XR Club Vice President starting this upcoming fall semester! D.J. is currently a Mentor for the XR Club who has lead the way to developing various innovative technologies and application for the club. Through his passion for immersive technologies, we know XR Club will continue to thrive! We're also happy to welcome a number of other members onto our leadership team, including Connor Hartzog and Abhinav Garlapati as mentors, Nicholas Nguyen as lab manager, Ajitesh Kaladi as our video producer, and Sahithi Jarugula as our marketing director. We look forward to working with you all as we continue to expand our XR community on campus this Fall!
 

XR CLUB EXHIBITS @ INNOVATE MARYLAND EXPO
The Innovate Maryland: Emerging Tech + Art Expo, hosted by MAVRIC in collaboration with Immersive Media Design (IMD) and the Arts for All Initiative, will take place Tuesday, May 10th from 5:00 PM to 9:00 PM inside the The Hall CP Longhouse, as well as throughout the ground floor of WeWork College Park. Join us for a fun evening exploring and interacting with emerging technologies through immersive media art, interactive augmented experiences, and virtual adventures in the Discovery District. We will be showcasing five amazing current and former student projects: Chessverse, Core Disruption (by MPLEX), Spray AR, Testudo-to-Go, and Corruptoartistry during the event. Hope to see you there! More details about this event can be found here: https://mavric.umd.edu/expo
 

NASA MARSXR CHALLENGE - CALL FOR MEMBERS
Interested in building Virtual Reality assets and scenarios for use by NASA in research focused on extravehicular activities (EVA) on the surface of Mars? The XR Club is putting together a team to compete in the NASA MarsXR Challenge, hosted by NASA, Epic Games and Buendea, where you will get to create new assets and scenarios for the new Mars XR Operations Support System (XOSS) environment, using Epic Games' Unreal Engine 5! If you’re interested in this exciting and intriguing challenge, don’t hesitate to reach out to XR Club Leadership or send a message in the MarsXR Discord channel! More about this challenge can be found here: https://www.herox.com/MarsXR

EXTERNAL XR-RELATED EVENTS

AWE USA 2022 - WHERE XR BUSINESS THRIVES
The Augmented World Expo USA 2022  conference is where you can discover how to harness the power of XR technology to increase productivity, accelerate innovation, and enhance customer experience. From June 1st to 3rd, AWE USA 2022 will take over Santa Clara Convention Center  and bring together the brightest minds and biggest names in the extended reality industry. Some of the world's leading companies that are involved include, including Microsoft, Unity, Qualcomm, Meta, and more. Attendees can expect to see the latest XR innovations across a range of industries, including health care, manufacturing, construction, retail, education, automotive, and more. More information about AWE USA 2022 can be found here: https://www.augmentedworldexpo.com/awe-usa-2022/
 

GAMES FOR CHANGE FESTIVAL 2022 + XR BRAIN JAM
For nearly two decades, the Games for Change Festival has been a destination for developers, educators, researchers, students, and other game-changers who want to make an impact through video games or immersive media. From July 13th - 14th, if you are near join the festival live in person in NYC at the Times Center with Microsoft for two days of curated talks, panels, and arcades with built-in networking opportunities throughout. Then, from July 15th - 16th, catch free online program for another two days of fresh content and talks to stream. Additionally, please consider taking part in the XR Brain Jam just before the festival (July 9-11), where you'll work with other professionals in a hackathon-style environment to prototype meaningful XR applications that will be featured at the festival. The deadline to apply to take part in this challenge is Sunday, May 15. More details about the festival and brain jam can be found below:
https://hopin.com/events/games-for-change-festival-2022/registration
https://xrbrainjam.org/
 

SMITHSONIAN MUSEUMS AR EXHIBITS - CRITICAL DISTANCE & REWILDAR
The Smithsonian Institution, the world's largest museum, research, and education complex is bringing us not one, but two augmented reality exhibits this summer! Critical Distance immerses visitors in a holographic orca pod and allows them to witness the challenges faced by this endangered species. This HoloLens 2-powered social augmented reality (AR) experience highlights a pod of 24 endangered Southern Resident orcas living in the Pacific Ocean’s Salish Sea. Then watch as the Futures that Inspire hall transforms into an overgrown wildflower meadow, bursting with virtual flowers and insects with ReWildAR.  Experience the ecosystem of a futuristic Washington, D.C., affected by climate change but still symbiosis with human life. More info about both exhibits can be found below: 
https://naturalhistory.si.edu/exhibits/critical-distance (Critical Distance)
https://aib.si.edu/futures_tamikothiel/ (ReWildAR)
 

XR IN THE NEWS

UMGC to pilot virtual reality classrooms this fall | The Diamondback

Niantic to Launch City-scale VPS for AR Devices Later This Month | Road to VR

NVIDIA Researchers Demonstrate Ultra-thin Holographic VR Glasses That Could Reach 120° Field-of-view | Road to VR

Find a cool article you’d like to share with other members of the club? Post it on the Discord server for a chance to have it featured in next week’s newsletter!
Copyright © 2022 XR Club, All rights reserved.


Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can update your preferences or unsubscribe from this list.

item.title: THE XREPORT | Week of 05/01/2022
item.description:
View this email in your browser
THE XREPORT
May 1, 2022

THIS WEEK'S TOPICS

Where to Go From Here? (Continue Exploring XR) Workshop | Reality Night
Students checking out our Discover XR Exhibit on Maryland Day!

XR CLUB NEWS AND EVENTS

LAST WEEK RECAP
Last Tuesday, we hosted our Introduction to the AR Cloud workshop, where attendees were guided through creating persistent AR experiences utilizing the power of the AR Cloud. If you missed it, please make sure to check the Discord for a recap soon. Also, we participated in Maryland Day, a day-long celebration on campus! The XR Club hosted a Discover XR exhibit in the Brendan Iribe Center during that time, where attendees had the chance to try out cool immersive experiences and check out projects that members of the club have been working on. Thanks to everyone who stopped by and we hope everyone had an awesome time! 
 

WORKSHOP: WHERE TO GO FROM HERE? (CONTINUE EXPLORING XR)
Throughout the semester we've discussed and worked with various forms of immersive technology. Through our workshops, gaming nights, and tech talks we hope you've gained a better understanding of what this technology is and how it's used. But what's next? How can you take what you've learned and apply it in your future career or even just a personal project? How do you keep on learning and exploring? Join us this Tuesday, May 3rd from 6:30 PM to 7:30 PM in the IMD Visualization Lab (AVW 3258) to find out! More info can be found here: https://terplink.umd.edu/event/8089732
 

REALITY NIGHT
Join us this Friday, May 6th, 2022 from 5:00 PM to 6:00 PM for our semesterly celebration: Reality Night! Stop by the Iribe Center Lobby and IRB 0110 to hang out with friends, grab some food and check out some of the cool XR projects that XR Club members have been working on throughout the semester. We'll also have an awards ceremony to recognize some notable members of the club as well as to recognize any graduating seniors. Hope to see you there! More details regarding this event can be found here: https://terplink.umd.edu/event/8089730
 

COVID-19 GUIDELINES
Please note that as per University guidelines, all attendees of our events and activities will be required to wear N95 or KN95 masks. Violators will be denied entry into our events/activities. Additionally, all of our members are encouraged to familiarize themselves with the University's latest COVID-19 Guidelines and take appropriate actions as necessary.

EXTERNAL XR-RELATED EVENTS

AIXR INSIGHTS LIVE | WHAT DOES THE METAVERSE MEAN FOR YOUR BUSINESS?
Join this Academy of International Extended Reality’s (AIXR) webinar on Tuesday, May 3rd, 2022 from 9:00 pm to 10:00 PM as they take a deep dive into what the Metaverse would mean for businesses and how companies can best adapt to next-gen tech applications? Speakers from three different companies, Olga Dogadkina (Emperia), Alex Blagirev (Sensorium), and Ramakrishnan C.N. (Entropia) will also delve into just how brands can enter the Metaverse space and how to prepare businesses for the big shift. More details can be found here: https://aixr.org/event-listing/aixr-insights-live-what-does-the-metaverse-mean-for-your-business/
 

YOUR JOURNEY INTO XR DEVELOPMENT - CAREERS IN MIXED REALITY
Join Microsoft and their Mixed Reality and Spatial Computing Cloud Advocacy teams on Tuesday, May 10th from 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM as they host a panel discussion to teach you more about careers in XR. During this live event, you can meet with members from the Mixed Reality team at Microsoft who'll share their experiences from working in the industry; Nick Klingensmith, one of the panelists, is a StereoKit Primary Maintainer who specializes in tool development, graphics programming, MR, and OpenXR, and with over 100 published games, he's worked on small arcade games, mobile GPU pushing titles, all the way to massively networked social games. More details regarding this event can be found here: https://www.meetup.com/hololens-mr/events/285596553/
 

VARJO REALITY CLOUD LAUNCH EVENT
Varjo makes revolutionary VR/XR hardware and software that together allow you to see and experience virtual and augmented content just as clearly as you see the analog world around us. Their virtual and mixed reality headsets take you to another level of performance and emotional immersion – recreating the exact feeling and conditions of real life, allowing you to perform better and learn faster. Join them on Wednesday, May 4th, 2022 at 11:00 AM to hear and see demos of how Varjo Reality Cloud can revolutionize the way top companies like Volvo work and collaborate globally – and how it enables the streaming of a truly photorealistic metaverse. More details can be found here: https://varjo.com/webinar/see-varjo-reality-cloud/

XR IN THE NEWS

Facebook is opening its first showroom to sell VR headsets | CNBC

CVS files to trademark its pharmacy and health clinics in the metaverse | CNBC

Holocaust museum's virtual reality exhibit is 'so realistic' | NBC News

Find a cool article you’d like to share with other members of the club? Post it on the Discord server for a chance to have it featured in next week’s newsletter!
Copyright © 2022 XR Club, All rights reserved.


Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can update your preferences or unsubscribe from this list.

item.title: THE XREPORT | Week of 04/24/2022
item.description:
View this email in your browser
THE XREPORT
April 24, 2022

THIS WEEK'S TOPICS

Intro to the AR Cloud (Persistent and Multi-User AR) Workshop | Discover XR Exhibit @ Maryland Day | XR Club Leadership Opportunities

XR Club members compete in the Core Disruption Mini-Tournament

XR CLUB NEWS AND EVENTS

LAST WEEK RECAP
Last Tuesday, we hosted our Exploring the Oculus Presence Platform workshop, where attendees were able to learn how to blend virtual content with the physical world, integrate hand and controller-centric interactions while also getting the opportunity to create their own gestures, and unlock the power of voice to create more accessible and frictionless immersive experiences. If you missed it, please make sure to check the Discord for a recap soon. Also, we participated in EarthFest, an event celebrating all things environment and sustainability! We showed three engaging VR films (Sea Plastic, Meet Your Carbon Footprint, The Crystal Reef) that aim to raise awareness about environmental issues and promote sustainable practices. Additionally, we hosted a Core Disruption Mini-Tournament last Friday, allowing members to experience a multiplayer tank combat game developed by UMD alumni and former XR Club members. Hope everyone had a fantastic time!
 

WORKSHOP: INTRODUCTION TO THE AR CLOUD (PERSISTENT AND MULTI-USER AR)
Join the XR Club this Tuesday, April 26th from 6:30 PM to 7:30 PM in the IMD Visualization Lab (AVW 3258) as we guide you through creating persistent location-aware AR experiences utilizing the power of the AR Cloud, the technology behind many cutting-edge AR applications like indoor navigation around an airport, in-store advertising, and AR-enhanced museum exhibits. Please make sure that you have Unity 2021.3 (LTS) installed prior to coming to the workshop with either the Android or iOS Build Support Module depending on your mobile device. If you have a iOS device, you should also install Xcode from the Mac App Store. More information can be found here: https://terplink.umd.edu/event/8080380
 

DISCOVER XR EXHIBIT @ MARYLAND DAY
Maryland Day 2022 is taking place this Saturday, April 30th, 2022 from 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM, and will feature hundreds of family-friendly events and interactive exhibits during a daylong celebration and inspiring journey across campus. The XR Club will be hosting a Discover XR exhibit in the Brendan Iribe Center during that time, where attendees will have the chance to try out cool immersive experiences and check out projects that members of the club have been working on! For more information about Maryland Day, please visit: 
https://marylandday.umd.edu/
 

LEADERSHIP OPPORTUNITIES
As some of our leadership members are graduating this Spring and our club continues to grow, we are looking to expand our leadership team for this upcoming Fall 2022 semester. Available positions include Vice President, Mentor, Lab Manager, Web Designer, Graphic Designer, Sandbox Liaison, and Video Producer. For more information on each role look no further than our XR Club Leadership Overview (https://ter.ps/xrleadership.) If you are interested, please fill out the Fall 2022 Leadership Application (https://ter.ps/xrleadf22). You are strongly recommended to apply by the priority deadline (Saturday, April 30th) but we will continue to review applications afterwards on a rolling basis until positions are filled. No prior XR experience is required for any of these positions, especially for our Mentor position. Just a passion for learning and the capacity to carry out all of the tasks and responsibilities of the role!
 

COVID-19 GUIDELINES
Please note that as per University guidelines, all attendees of our events and activities will be required to wear N95 or KN95 masks. Violators will be denied entry into our events/activities. Additionally, all of our members are encouraged to familiarize themselves with the University's latest COVID-19 Guidelines and take appropriate actions as necessary.

EXTERNAL XR-RELATED EVENTS

BLACK BROADWAY ON U: 360 VIRTUAL TOUR
Attend the launch of the Black Broadway on U 360 Virtual tour at Ben's Chili Bowl on Friday, April 29th from 5:30 PM to 8:30 PM! Produced in partnership with Black Broadway on U Executive Producer, Shellee Haynesworth, this 360 virtual tour teleports viewers to historic locations throughout Washington DC's "Black Broadway," an area that birthed D.C.’s Black Renaissance and served as a prominent symbol of black culture and sophistication amid racial and political tension in America. The panel features 3 UMD students who helped create the tour as part of the Break Through Tech DC's Sprinternship program. This event is free to attend! Also I4C will have transportation options (Uber refunds, etc) and meal vouchers for all UMD students who attend; if you’re interested in that, please contact Katie Bemb for details: breakthroughtech@umd.edu. More details can be found here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/black-broadway-on-u-360-virtual-tour-tickets-309122191797
 

VIRTUAL REALITY AS A RESEARCH TOOL
Presented by the Yale Blended Reality Project with support from HP and Intel, on Thursday, April 28th, from 1:00 PM to 2:30 PM, learn how VR technology provides researchers with tools to rapidly prototype test environments that immerse subjects into an experience, while providing data on eye gaze, pupil dilation and other reactive measures. The ability to rapidly iterate scenarios without the limitations of managing a physical location offers new ways to think about the design of a research study. Costs and capabilities of VR equipment and authoring tools are rapidly improving, bringing these technologies within reach for research teams. During this 90-minute session researchers from Yale, Syracuse University and HP will discuss VR platforms for research and provide practical examples to help attendees understand how to incorporate VR into their own research designs. More details regarding this free session can be found here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/virtual-reality-as-a-research-tool-tickets-317166612877
 

YOUR JOURNEY INTO XR DEVELOPMENT - 3D MODELING & WORLD BUILDING
Join Microsoft and their Mixed Reality and Spatial Computing Cloud Advocacy teams as they show you how to get started with XR featuring sessions for both developers and non-developers alike. Modeling the world and objects surrounding us is made possible with various design tools for both beginners and advanced creators. On Tuesday, April 26th from 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM, April Speight, a Senior Cloud Advocate with Microsoft, will teach you about some of the tools available for 3D modeling and how you can leverage such tools to create your own virtual world. More details regarding this event can be found here: https://www.meetup.com/hololens-mr/events/285111905/

XR IN THE NEWS

Goldman likes Meta’s moves in the metaverse — and gives the stock serious upside | CNBC

Canon’s MREAL X1 4K Headset Fuses Reality and CG in Real-Time | PetaPixel

Prehistoric humans turned their campfires into makeshift movie theaters | CNN

View this email in your browser
THE XREPORT
April 24, 2022

THIS WEEK'S TOPICS

Intro to the AR Cloud (Persistent and Multi-User AR) Workshop | Discover XR Exhibit @ Maryland Day | XR Club Leadership Opportunities

XR Club members compete in the Core Disruption Mini-Tournament

XR CLUB NEWS AND EVENTS

LAST WEEK RECAP
Last Tuesday, we hosted our Exploring the Oculus Presence Platform workshop, where attendees were able to learn how to blend virtual content with the physical world, integrate hand and controller-centric interactions while also getting the opportunity to create their own gestures, and unlock the power of voice to create more accessible and frictionless immersive experiences. If you missed it, please make sure to check the Discord for a recap soon. Also, we participated in EarthFest, an event celebrating all things environment and sustainability! We showed three engaging VR films (Sea Plastic, Meet Your Carbon Footprint, The Crystal Reef) that aim to raise awareness about environmental issues and promote sustainable practices. Additionally, we hosted a Core Disruption Mini-Tournament last Friday, allowing members to experience a multiplayer tank combat game developed by UMD alumni and former XR Club members. Hope everyone had a fantastic time!
 

WORKSHOP: INTRODUCTION TO THE AR CLOUD (PERSISTENT AND MULTI-USER AR)
Join the XR Club this Tuesday, April 26th from 6:30 PM to 7:30 PM in the IMD Visualization Lab (AVW 3258) as we guide you through creating persistent location-aware AR experiences utilizing the power of the AR Cloud, the technology behind many cutting-edge AR applications like indoor navigation around an airport, in-store advertising, and AR-enhanced museum exhibits. Please make sure that you have Unity 2021.3 (LTS) installed prior to coming to the workshop with either the Android or iOS Build Support Module depending on your mobile device. If you have a iOS device, you should also install Xcode from the Mac App Store. More information can be found here: https://terplink.umd.edu/event/8080380
 

DISCOVER XR EXHIBIT @ MARYLAND DAY
Maryland Day 2022 is taking place this Saturday, April 30th, 2022 from 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM, and will feature hundreds of family-friendly events and interactive exhibits during a daylong celebration and inspiring journey across campus. The XR Club will be hosting a Discover XR exhibit in the Brendan Iribe Center during that time, where attendees will have the chance to try out cool immersive experiences and check out projects that members of the club have been working on! For more information about Maryland Day, please visit: 
https://marylandday.umd.edu/
 

LEADERSHIP OPPORTUNITIES
As some of our leadership members are graduating this Spring and our club continues to grow, we are looking to expand our leadership team for this upcoming Fall 2022 semester. Available positions include Vice President, Mentor, Lab Manager, Web Designer, Graphic Designer, Sandbox Liaison, and Video Producer. For more information on each role look no further than our XR Club Leadership Overview (https://ter.ps/xrleadership.) If you are interested, please fill out the Fall 2022 Leadership Application (https://ter.ps/xrleadf22). You are strongly recommended to apply by the priority deadline (Saturday, April 30th) but we will continue to review applications afterwards on a rolling basis until positions are filled. No prior XR experience is required for any of these positions, especially for our Mentor position. Just a passion for learning and the capacity to carry out all of the tasks and responsibilities of the role!
 

COVID-19 GUIDELINES
Please note that as per University guidelines, all attendees of our events and activities will be required to wear N95 or KN95 masks. Violators will be denied entry into our events/activities. Additionally, all of our members are encouraged to familiarize themselves with the University's latest COVID-19 Guidelines and take appropriate actions as necessary.

EXTERNAL XR-RELATED EVENTS

BLACK BROADWAY ON U: 360 VIRTUAL TOUR
Attend the launch of the Black Broadway on U 360 Virtual tour at Ben's Chili Bowl on Friday, April 29th from 5:30 PM to 8:30 PM! Produced in partnership with Black Broadway on U Executive Producer, Shellee Haynesworth, this 360 virtual tour teleports viewers to historic locations throughout Washington DC's "Black Broadway," an area that birthed D.C.’s Black Renaissance and served as a prominent symbol of black culture and sophistication amid racial and political tension in America. The panel features 3 UMD students who helped create the tour as part of the Break Through Tech DC's Sprinternship program. This event is free to attend! Also I4C will have transportation options (Uber refunds, etc) and meal vouchers for all UMD students who attend; if you’re interested in that, please contact Katie Bemb for details: breakthroughtech@umd.edu. More details can be found here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/black-broadway-on-u-360-virtual-tour-tickets-309122191797
 

VIRTUAL REALITY AS A RESEARCH TOOL
Presented by the Yale Blended Reality Project with support from HP and Intel, on Thursday, April 28th, from 1:00 PM to 2:30 PM, learn how VR technology provides researchers with tools to rapidly prototype test environments that immerse subjects into an experience, while providing data on eye gaze, pupil dilation and other reactive measures. The ability to rapidly iterate scenarios without the limitations of managing a physical location offers new ways to think about the design of a research study. Costs and capabilities of VR equipment and authoring tools are rapidly improving, bringing these technologies within reach for research teams. During this 90-minute session researchers from Yale, Syracuse University and HP will discuss VR platforms for research and provide practical examples to help attendees understand how to incorporate VR into their own research designs. More details regarding this free session can be found here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/virtual-reality-as-a-research-tool-tickets-317166612877
 

YOUR JOURNEY INTO XR DEVELOPMENT - 3D MODELING & WORLD BUILDING
Join Microsoft and their Mixed Reality and Spatial Computing Cloud Advocacy teams as they show you how to get started with XR featuring sessions for both developers and non-developers alike. Modeling the world and objects surrounding us is made possible with various design tools for both beginners and advanced creators. On Tuesday, April 26th from 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM, April Speight, a Senior Cloud Advocate with Microsoft, will teach you about some of the tools available for 3D modeling and how you can leverage such tools to create your own virtual world. More details regarding this event can be found here: https://www.meetup.com/hololens-mr/events/285111905/

XR IN THE NEWS

Goldman likes Meta’s moves in the metaverse — and gives the stock serious upside | CNBC

Canon’s MREAL X1 4K Headset Fuses Reality and CG in Real-Time | PetaPixel

Prehistoric humans turned their campfires into makeshift movie theaters | CNN

item.title: THE XREPORT | Week of 04/17/2022
item.description:
View this email in your browser
THE XREPORT
April 17, 2022

THIS WEEK'S TOPICS

Exploring the Oculus Presence Platform Workshop | VR Short Films @ EarthFest | XR Club T-Shirt Orders

XR Club members compete in the Mario Kart AR Tournament

XR CLUB NEWS AND EVENTS

LAST WEEK RECAP
Last Tuesday, we hosted our Build Your Own XR Tracking System from Scratch workshop, where attendees were able to learn about the fundamentals of today’s common strategies for tracking VR devices and build their own “trackers” that could be seen and tracked by their webcams. If you missed it, please make sure to check the Discord for a recap soon. Additionally, we hosted our first ever Mario Kart AR Tournament last Friday. We were able to turn the Iribe Center floors into a Mario Kart race track, complete with obstacles, speed boosts, and great competitors. Congratulations to Case Briscoe for winning the tournament after a close final match! Hope everyone had a great time and we look forward to hosting similar fun events in the future!
 

WORKSHOP: EXPLORING THE OCULUS PRESENCE PLATFORM
Unleash the power of mixed reality, voice, and advanced interactions on your Oculus headset with the Oculus Presence Platform, come as we explore the platform's capabilities on Tuesday, April 19th at 6:30 PM in the IMD Visualization Lab (AVW 3258) Learn how to blend virtual content with the physical world, enable spatial anchors that allow virtual content to persist across various sessions, and create scene aware experiences with rich user experiences with the Insight SDK; you will also be able to integrate hand and controller-centric interactions while also getting the opportunity to create your own gestures with the Interaction SDK. Finally, unlock the power of voice to create more accessible and frictionless experiences with the new Voice SDK. Please make sure to bring a computer with Unity 2021.3 (LTS) installed prior to the workshop, along with the Android Build Support module and the options for the Android SDK & NDK Tools and OpenJDK. More information can be found at https://terplink.umd.edu/event/8066865
 

VR SHORT FILMS @ EARTHFEST
The Student Government Association (SGA) and SustainableUMD are co-hosting the first ever annual EarthFest event at Hornbake Plaza on Wednesday, April 20th from 11:00 AM to 3:00 PM., in celebration of Earth Day later this week! As part of the event, the XR Club will be hosting a table to showcase three VR short films designed to enable attendees to visualize the impact of pollution in order to inspire change and action. For more info, please visit https://terplink.umd.edu/event/8048208
 

XR CLUB T-SHIRT ORDERS
XR Club Drip! We are organizing a group order of custom XR Club T-Shirts to reflect our new branding. You can check out the design at the link below. The specific cost will be determined based on the volume once the order is placed, but it is estimated to cost around $25 - $30. If you're interested in purchasing a t-shirt, please fill out the t-shirt request form no later than Thursday, April 21st.
 https://forms.gle/7TQ7fu8p2s7go63AA
 

COVID-19 GUIDELINES
Please note that as per University guidelines, all attendees of our events and activities will be required to wear N95 or KN95 masks. Violators will be denied entry into our events/activities. Additionally, all of our members are encouraged to familiarize themselves with the University's latest COVID-19 Guidelines and take appropriate actions as necessary.

EXTERNAL XR-RELATED EVENTS

YOUR JOURNEY INTO XR DEVELOPMENT: THE STRUCTURAL ELEMENTS OF XR
Much like a compound in chemistry is made of elements from the Periodic Table of Elements, XR solutions are built from a variety of building blocks. What are some of the building blocks of XR? What is a coordinate system? Scene understanding? Room scan visualization? Spatial anchors? In this session on Tuesday, April 19th at 12:00 PM, Thomas Lewis, a Spatial Computing Advocate at Microsoft, will guide you as you put on your lab coats and set up your lab, and provide an introduction to some of the fundamental building blocks so that you can create or design XR applications. This event is free to attend. More details can be found here: https://www.meetup.com/hololens-mr/events/285088477/ 
 

XR AT MICHIGAN SUMMIT 2022
This hybrid event will span two days, from Tuesday, April 19th to Wednesday, April 20th, and will feature industry professionals and University of Michigan faculty innovators sharing their knowledge and insight around XR. The XR at Michigan Summit will utilize the virtual event platform, Hopin, for day one of the event. Some of the sessions provided at the summit include: developing custom-built VR apps, exploring XR environments, interpersonal practice in XR, and more! This event is free to register for! More details regarding the summit as well as registration can be found here: https://hopin.com/events/xr-at-michigan-summit-2022
 

NEXT GENERATION SMARTGLASSES
The AWE Night NYC Meetup group will be hosting a virtual panel discussion about next-gen AR smartglasses and contact lenses on Tuesday, April 19th at 5:00 PM. Hear from executives of some of the most innovative startups in the space, including LYNX, Tilt5, Mojo Vision, and Kura Tech as you ask away questions about the future of AR. Attendees will also have a chance to network with professionals in the XR field. More details and registration can be found at https://www.meetup.com/AWENiteNYC/events/282924853/

XR IN THE NEWS

NASA Virtually Teleports Doctor Hundred of Miles In Space To Show Off ‘Holoportation’ | Wccftech

Chemical Haptics could bring touch sensations like cold and heat to VR | PC Gamer

Pokémon Go developer Niantic is making an AR pet game called Peridot | The Verge

Behind Mark Zuckerberg's big plans for AR glasses | The Verge

Find a cool article you’d like to share with other members of the club? Post it on the Discord server for a chance to have it featured in next week’s newsletter!
Copyright © 2022 XR Club, All rights reserved.

item.title: THE XREPORT | Week of 04/10/2022
item.description:
View this email in your browser
THE XREPORT
April 10, 2022

THIS WEEK'S TOPICS

Build Your Own XR Tracking System - Mario Kart AR Tournament

Ariana Grande performing in Fortnite (Source: The Verge)

XR CLUB NEWS AND EVENTS

LAST WEEK RECAP:
Last week, we hosted the second episode of our "Introduction to AR Development" workshop series. Attendees were able to place their own virtual pet into a physical space, interact with it using some common AR touch gestures, and utilize information about the real-world environment in order to make the digital objects fit in realistically. If you missed it, please make sure to check the Discord for a recap soon. 
 

BUILD YOUR OWN XR TRACKING SYSTEM FROM SCRATCH
Have you ever wondered how VR headsets are able to seamlessly track your head and controllers while you play? Are you interested in full-body tracking solutions for VR games, where your virtual avatar’s arm and leg movements match almost perfectly with your own? Then join us on Tuesday, April 12th at 6:30 PM in the Sandbox Makerspace (IRB 1231) for our Build Your Own XR Tracking System from Scratch workshop. We will start off by providing a crash course on the fundamentals of VR tracking hardware and full-body tracking. Then, using these principles, you will build your very own “tracker” that can be seen and tracked by your laptop's webcam. More information can be found on our TerpLink here: https://terplink.umd.edu/event/8049140
 

MARIO KART AR TOURNAMENT
Vroom! Vroom! Get ready for a Mario Kart tournament like never before — in augmented reality! We'll be using the  Nintendo Switch to turn the Iribe Center floors into a Mario Kart race track, complete with obstacles, speed boosts, and more! This is a great opportunity to meet other members of the club, try out augmented reality games, and compete in a fun and friendly environment. Come out this Friday, April 15th at 5:00 PM to compete and show off your skills in this new and exciting form of gaming! More information will be posted soon on our Discord and TerpLink.
 

COVID-19 GUIDELINES
Please note that as per University guidelines, all attendees of our events and activities will be required to wear N95 or KN95 masks. Violators will be denied entry into our events/activities. Additionally, all of our members are encouraged to familiarize themselves with the University's latest COVID-19 Guidelines and take appropriate actions as necessary.

EXTERNAL XR-RELATED EVENTS

LEARN VIRTUAL REALITY DEVELOPMENT IN THE METAVERSE WITH UNITY
Join Universe on Thursday, April 14th at 8:00 PM, a company that teaches VR app development with Unity live in the metaverse, for a meetup in the metaverse explaining what the Unity game engine is, discussing Unity vs other engines, and how to use Unity for VR development. This holoportation-enabled class will be complete with 3D experiences, assessment, and networking. If you want to learn how to build VR and 3D apps using Unity in the metaverse, this is the meetup for you! No previous experience is needed. More details and free registration can be found here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/learn-virtual-reality-development-in-the-metaverse-with-unity-tickets-312109155887
 

WOMEN TRANSFORMING TECHNOLOGY CONFERENCE
Interested in learning more about women and their stories in the technology field? Women Transforming Technology (WT2) is a consortium of companies and organizations in the industry, academia, and non-profit sectors committed to building a community and tackling issues that are top of mind for women in technology. This conference will take place virtually from April 11th to April 12th.  It will include a personal development track by speaker, Amy Hensiek, who will talk about her experience as a partner in a virtual reality startup on Monday, April 11th at 2:30 PM. Anyone is welcome to attend this conference and registration is free! More details can be found here: https://www.womentransformingtechnology.com/
 

Gaymer Night
On Thursday, April 14th at 5:30 PM in IRB 0110, the Information Science (Info Sci) and Immersive Media Design (IMD) programs are co-hosting a Gaymer Night! Stop by to take a break, decompress, and bond with your peers for virtual reality experiences, board games, and refreshments.

XR IN THE NEWS

Epic and Lego partner to build a metaverse for kids | The Verge

VR company Engage partners with Victory XR to launch ten metaversities in the US | Business Leader

How a Parachute Accident Helped Jump-Start Augmented Reality | IEEE Spectrum

Find a cool article you’d like to share with other members of the club? Post it on the Discord server for a chance to have it featured in next week’s newsletter!
Copyright © 2022 XR Club, All rights reserved.


Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can update your preferences or unsubscribe from this list.

On Thursday, April 14th at 5:30 PM in IRB 0110, the Information Science (Info Sci) and Immersive Media Design (IMD) programs are co-hosting a Gaymer Night! Stop by to take a break, decompress, and bond with your peers for virtual reality experiences, board games, and refreshments.

XR IN THE NEWS

Epic and Lego partner to build a metaverse for kids | The Verge

VR company Engage partners with Victory XR to launch ten metaversities in the US | Business Leader

How a Parachute Accident Helped Jump-Start Augmented Reality | IEEE Spectrum

item.title: THE XREPORT | Week of 04/03/2022
item.description:
View this email in your browser
THE XREPORT
April 03, 2022

THIS WEEK'S TOPICS

Intro to AR Development (Part II) Workshop —Bitcamp 2022
Wendy's, the unlikely company making its way into the metaverse (Source: NRN)

XR CLUB NEWS AND EVENTS

LAST WEEK RECAP:
We hope you all had a wonderful first week back from spring break! Last week we started our Intro to AR Development workshop series, where attendees built their own smartphone AR experience from scratch! If you missed it, please make sure to check the Discord for a recap soon. Additionally, attendees learned the best practices and the available tools for designing their own AR holographic applications, all while experiencing the power of the Microsoft HoloLens 2.
 

WORKSHOP: INTRO TO AR DEVELOPMENT (PART 2 - INTRO TO ACTIONS AND REALISM)
Join the XR Club this Tuesday, April 5th at 6:30 PM in CSI 2117 for the second part of our AR Development workshop series, where you'll build upon your application from last week in order to place your very own virtual pet into your physical space, interact with it using some common AR touch gestures, and utilize information about the real-world environment in order to make the digital objects fit in realistically. We'll be using the new Unity XR Tech Stack, including AR Foundation, a multi-platform framework that connects you to the core underlying capabilities of both smartphone and headset based AR platforms, and the XR Interaction Toolkit, which allows you to quickly and easily add common AR/VR interactions into your Unity app. No prior experience is necessary; all majors welcome! Please make sure that you have Unity 2021.2 (or higher) installed prior to coming to the workshop with either the Android or iOS Build Support Module depending on your mobile device. If you have a iOS device, you should also install Xcode from the Mac App Store. Make sure to look out for more details coming soon on TerpLink and our Discord server.
 

COVID-19 GUIDELINES
Please note that as per University guidelines, all attendees of our events and activities will be required to wear N95 or KN95 masks. Violators will be denied entry into our events/activities. Additionally, all of our members are encouraged to familiarize themselves with the University's latest COVID-19 Guidelines and take appropriate actions as necessary.

EXTERNAL XR-RELATED EVENTS

THE IMMERSIVE MEDIA + ARTS FOR ALL SHOWCASE
The Immersive Media + Arts for All Showcase is a weeklong event from Saturday, April 2nd, 2022 to April 8th, 2022 produced and presented by the University of Maryland’s Immersive Media Design (IMD) program, the College of Arts and Humanities, the College of Computer, Mathematical, and Natural Sciences and the campus-wide Arts for All initiative. Through installations, performances and talks, we will demonstrate the ways that immersive media can bring the arts into dialogue with cutting-edge digital technology to transform public spaces and further social good. The events schedule can be found here: https://arhu.umd.edu/events/immersive-media-arts-all-showcase
 

BITCAMP
Held from April 8th to April 10th, Bitcamp is a 36 hour hackathon and the prime opportunity to delve into your curiosities, learn something new, and build something awesome. With world-class mentors and 1,200+ fellow campers, you're in for an amazing experience. This hackathon is the perfect opportunity to own the awesome XR skills you've learned so far and make the hack of a lifetime. Whether you're a seasoned hacker or completely new to the world of hacking, we'll have something for you. If you're ready for an adventure, see you by the fire! More details can be found here: https://bit.camp/
 

INTERACTION DESIGN AND PROTOTYPING FOR XR OPEN HOUSE WITH MANUEL SAINSILY
Interested in pursuing a design career in the XR world? Circuit Stream is hosting a free and live webinar on Thursday, April 7th at 3:00 PM to learn how you can get started designing XR experiences and acquire the skills needed to succeed in the industry. Our special guest, Manuel Sainsily, a Design Manager of Digital Twins at Unity will share his own career path with you and offer advice and recommendations on how to obtain skills, share your work, and get your foot in the door as an XR designer. This presentation will start promptly at the scheduled time, and will run for roughly 45 minutes, followed by a 15 minute Q&A session. If you're interested, more information can be found here: https://circuitstream.com/workshop/interaction-design-and-prototyping-for-xr-open-house-with-manuel-sainsily/ 

XR IN THE NEWS

VR compatible butter “The Sushi Device” on sale now | SoraNews24 

I went to fashion week in the metaverse | CNN 

Wendy’s open virtual-reality Wendyverse restaurant April 2 | Nation’s Restaurant News 

Find a cool article you’d like to share with other members of the club? Post it in the Discord server for a chance to have it featured in next week’s newsletter!
Copyright © 2022 XR Club, All rights reserved.

item.title: THE XREPORT | Week of 03/27/2022
item.description:
View this email in your browser
THE XREPORT
March 27th, 2022

THIS WEEK'S TOPICS

Intro to AR Development (Part I) Workshop — Experience Your World...with Holograms
Liberland, a newly announced virtual city in the metaverse (Source: CNN)

XR CLUB NEWS AND EVENTS

2-WEEK RECAP:
Hope you all had a great spring break last week! If you worked on or tried out any cool XR experience over break, definitely let us know in the Discord! Before the break, we hosted our "Intro to 3D Modeling with Blender" workshop, where attendees designed their own virtual 3D model of a VR headset. If you missed it, please make sure to check the Discord for a recap soon.
 

WORKSHOP: INTRO TO AR DEVELOPMENT (PART I - SENSING THE ENVIROMENT)
We'll be starting our Intro to AR Development workshop series on Tuesday, March 29th at 6:30 PM in CSI 2117. Join us as we show you just how easy it is to build your own smartphone AR experience from scratch! We'll be using Unity's AR Foundation, a multi-platform framework that connects you to the core underlying capabilities of both smartphones- and headset-based AR platforms. In the first part of this workshop series, you'll learn how to get the camera stream to show up in your application, how to track and visualize features of the environment, like planes and point clouds, and how to deploy an AR application to your phone. Please make sure that you have Unity 2021.2 (or higher) installed prior to coming to the workshop with either the Android or iOS Build Support Module  depending on your mobile device. If you have a iOS device, you should also install Xcode from the Mac App Store. More details can be found at https://terplink.umd.edu/event/8010609.
 

FEATURED EXPERIENCE: EXPERIENCE YOUR WORLD...WITH HOLOGRAMS:
Get ready for an evening of fun as you explore the real-world with holograms! Join us this Friday, April 1st from at 5:00 PM in IRB 0110 and get the chance to try on the Microsoft HoloLens 2! Save yourself from robot invaders that are breaking through the walls of the Iribe Center! Send strikes of lightning and play with fire just with your bare hands! See how science education can be reimagined through engaging 3D chemistry and astronomy visualizations! And learn about the best practices and the available tools for designing your own AR holographic applications...all while experiencing the power of the most cutting-edge AR headset available today with features like hand-tracking and eye-tracking! More details coming soon to Discord and TerpLink.
 

COVID-19 GUIDELINES
Please note that as per University guidelines, all attendees of our events and activities will be required to wear N95 or KN95 masks. Violators will be denied entry into our events/activities. Additionally, all of our members are encouraged to familiarize themselves with the University's latest COVID-19 Guidelines and take appropriate actions as necessary.

EXTERNAL XR-RELATED EVENTS

DOUBLE EYE STUDIOS VR PRODUCTION WORKSHOP
The Immersive Media Design (IMD) program has invited Double Eye Studios to host a 2-day intensive on VR production this weekend (April 2-3). Students will get a hands-on and headset-on experience of the essential elements of creating a work of live performance in VR. The workshop will include performances of Double Eye Studio’s award-winning VR production “Finding Pandora X.” More details and registration found at: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeDri6z43iFTykaCG2d5MD0HrkEX6PDJS1Unjhjcef66SdJmw/viewform
 

TECH TALK: BUILDING DIGITAL TWINS AND INTERACTING WITH IT IN THE METAVERSE
Ashwin Swaminabrashthan, Perception and Data Leader of Amazon's Fashion Innovation tech team, has been invited to host a guest lecture on Thursday, March 31st at 3:30PM, taking place in IRB 4105 as well as virtually on Zoom. Join as he presents an overview of the computer vision and deep learning work that is involved in building the Metaverse: world sensing, user sensing and interactions. To join via Zoom, please use the following link: https://umd.zoom.us/j/94021557450?pwd=eDNPaFdWU3ZSV2ZUNGp1Nno1UnFKdz09
 

UX AND XR DEVELOPERS: WORKING TOGETHER
Circuit Stream is hosting a workshop on Wednesday, March 31st at 3:00 PM. This workshop is dedicated for project teams, UX designers and XR developers. They will share how the development processes integrate between the two roles and how to communicate and work together to produce amazing experiences. By the end of this workshop you will know the value of UX in the development process, how to integrate UX design into development process, how XR designers and developers can communicate effectively, and the best practices from the UX industry veteran who works in XR. Even if you're working as a solo developer or designer, knowing these best practices will help you tremendously with your projects. More details and registration can be found at: https://circuitstream.com/workshop/ux-and-xr-developers-working-together/

XR IN THE NEWS

Snap buys brain-computer interface startup for future AR glasses |The Verge

Ambitious plans unveiled for a libertarian city in the metaverse | CNN

The NBA aired an entire game using volumetric video tech that renders players in 3D in real-time | TechSpot

Find a cool article you’d like to share with other members of the club? Post it in the Discord server for a chance to have it featured in next week’s newsletter!
Copyright © 2022 XR Club, All rights reserved.


Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can update your preferences or unsubscribe from this list.

item.title: THE XREPORT | Week of 03/13/2022
item.description:
View this email in your browser
THE XREPORT
March 13th, 2022

THIS WEEK'S TOPICS

Intro to 3D Modeling with Blender Workshop
Holoride's In-Car VR Entertainment System

XR CLUB NEWS AND EVENTS

LAST WEEK RECAP
Last Tuesday we hosted the second episode of our "Introduction to VR Development" workshop series. Attendees were able to integrate spatial audio and haptic feedback as well as UI components into their Beat Saber Clone, "Bleat Shaver"! If you missed it, please make sure to check the Discord for a recap soon. Additionally, we co-hosted a gaming night last Thursday with our friends at Break Through Tech (BTT), Immersive Media Design (IMD), the Iribe Initiative for Inclusion and Diversity in Computing (I4C), the iSchool, and InfoSci FI, watch out for more events like this in the near future. Finally, we discussed essential CS electives that are centered around skills needed to succeed in the XR industry in our tech talk "What CS Electives Should I Take? (An XR Student's Perspective)". 
 

WORKSHOP: INTRO TO 3D MODELING WITH BLENDER
We'll be hosting our Intro to 3D Modeling With Blender workshop series on Tuesday, March 15th at 6:30 PM in CSI 2117. In this workshop, you will  create your own 3D model of a VR Headset (VR inside VR)! Along the way you'll learn about navigating around the interface of the Blender software, some crucial modeling concepts like using edge loops and extrusions, rendering your 3D model to view it in a more realistic high-res format, how to utilize modifiers effectively, and exporting your final creation to share with others, or to import it into an XR development software like Unity! Please make sure that you have Blender 3.0 (or higher) installed prior to coming to the workshop. More details can be found at https://terplink.umd.edu/event/7985795.
 

COVID-19 GUIDELINES
Please note that as per University guidelines, all attendees of our events and activities will be required to wear N95 or KN95 masks. Violators will be denied entry into our events/activities. Additionally, all of our members are encouraged to familiarize themselves with the University's latest COVID-19 Guidelines and take appropriate actions as necessary.

EXTERNAL XR-RELATED EVENTS

ENHANCE XR EXPERIENCES WITH AZURE SERVICES 
The Mixed Reality and Spatial Computing Cloud Advocacy teams at Microsoft are hosting their next episode of the Journey into XR Development series on Tuesday, March 15th at 1:00 PM. In this fourth episode, they will explore prototypes for immersive XR experiences that leverages the power of Azure Cognitive Services which enables features such as speech recognition, speech translation, object detection, and even a bot! More details and registration found at: https://www.meetup.com/hololens-mr/events/284463531/


HOW EYE TRACKING IMPROVES PERFORMANCE IN VR/XR SIMULATION
Join Varjo's webinar on Tuesday, March 15th at 11:00 AM! You’ll discover why eye tracking technology improves performance, deepens behavioral insights, and enables more thorough analytics for your training, education and research simulations. More details and registration found at: https://varjo.com/webinar/webinar-insight-session-improve-performance-and-deepen-user-insights-with-eye-tracking-for-vr-xr/
 

MAKE YOUR OWN BREAKOUT RETRO GAME IN UNITY
Circuit Stream is hosting a Unity workshop on Wednesday, March 16th at 3:00 PM. In this free Unity workshop, They will teach you'll  learn about Unity controls, interface, and main features first. Then take those fundamentals and learn and understand different objects, input commands, simple interactions and types of game objects.This workshop is free and doesn't assume any pre-existing knowledge. By the end of the workshop you will know how to use Unity for simple game projects and beyond. More details and registration can be found at: https://circuitstream.com/workshop/make-your-own-breakout-retro-game-in-unity/.

XR IN THE NEWS

Pokémon GO creator Niantic is acquiring WebAR development platform 8th Wall |TechCrunch

Magic Leap shows off its next-generation enterprise AR glasses | VentureBeat

Holoride’s in-car VR tech is coming to Audi this summer | TechCrunch

Find a cool article you’d like to share with other members of the club? Post it in the Discord server for a chance to have it featured in next week’s newsletter!
Copyright © 2022 XR Club, All rights reserved.

ENHANCE XR EXPERIENCES WITH AZURE SERVICES

HOW EYE TRACKING IMPROVES PERFORMANCE IN VR/XR SIMULATION
Join Varjo's webinar on Tuesday, March 15th at 11:00 AM! You’ll discover why eye tracking technology improves performance, deepens behavioral insights, and enables more thorough analytics for your training, education and research simulations. More details and registration found at: https://varjo.com/webinar/webinar-insight-session-improve-performance-and-deepen-user-insights-with-eye-tracking-for-vr-xr/
 

MAKE YOUR OWN BREAKOUT RETRO GAME IN UNITY
Circuit Stream is hosting a Unity workshop on Wednesday, March 16th at 3:00 PM. In this free Unity workshop, They will teach you'll  learn about Unity controls, interface, and main features first. Then take those fundamentals and learn and understand different objects, input commands, simple interactions and types of game objects.This workshop is free and doesn't assume any pre-existing knowledge. By the end of the workshop you will know how to use Unity for simple game projects and beyond. More details and registration can be found at: https://circuitstream.com/workshop/make-your-own-breakout-retro-game-in-unity/.

XR IN THE NEWS

Pokémon GO creator Niantic is acquiring WebAR development platform 8th Wall |TechCrunch

Magic Leap shows off its next-generation enterprise AR glasses | VentureBeat

Holoride’s in-car VR tech is coming to Audi this summer | TechCrunch

item.title: THE XREPORT | Week of 03/06/2022
item.description:
View this email in your browser
THE XREPORT
March 6th, 2022

THIS WEEK'S TOPICS

Intro to VR Development (Part II) Workshop — Gaming Night
What CS Electives Should I Take? (An XR Student's Perspective) Student Talk
SK Telecom’s “4D Metaverse” ride at Mobile World Congress 2022

XR CLUB NEWS AND EVENTS

LAST WEEK RECAP
Last Tuesday we hosted the first episode of our "Introduction to VR Development" workshop series. Attendees were able where able to configure a Unity Project for VR and deploy our "Bleat Shaver" game on some Oculus Quest 2s! If you missed it, please make sure to check the Discord for a recap soon. Additionally, we hosted our Projects Kickoff last Friday, where we announced the four projects we will build out this semester: Graffiti AR, Multiplayer VR Escape Room Knockout, Campus Navigation AR, and VR Grand Theft Auto - UMD Edition. Students were able to meet their team members and start developing a plan to create their projects. If you are interested in joining a team, please contact Jason or Sahil on Discord.
 

WORKSHOP: INTRO TO VR DEVELOPMENT (PART II)
We'll be hosting the second part of our Intro to VR Development workshop series on Tuesday, March 8th at 6:30 PM in CSI 2117. In this second episode of the workshop series, you will continue to make your Beat Saber clone, Bleat Shaver more immersive! Along the way, you will integrate spatial audio and haptic feedback to enable more immersive interactions and learn how to transform user interfaces (UIs) to work well in a 3D environment as you create menus and score displays for your game. We will have a limited number of headsets for participants to share, but feel free to bring your own Quest if you have one. Additionally, please make sure that you have Unity 2021.2 (or higher) along with the Android Build Support module (and its OpenJDK + Android SDK/NDK dependencies) installed prior to coming to the workshop. More details can be found at https://terplink.umd.edu/event/7970818.
 

GAMING NIGHT
Come join us this Thursday, March 10th at 5:30 PM in IRB 0110 for an evening of fun and games! We'll be hosting a night of gaming with some of our closest friends from Break Through Tech (BTT), Immersive Media Design (IMD), the Iribe Initiative for Inclusion and Diversity in Computing (I4C), the iSchool, and InfoSci FI. There will be something for everyone, so come out and enjoy some friendly competition. More details can be found at https://terplink.umd.edu/event/7971682.
 

WHAT CS ELECTIVES SHOULD I TAKE? (AN XR STUDENT'S PERSPECTIVE):
It's almost time to register for next semester's classes! However sifting through the vast selection of upper-level computer science electives can be a daunting task. Join us this Friday, March 11th at 5:00 PM in CSI 1121 as we discuss our recommendations on the CS electives you should take to learn the fundamental concepts that drive AR/VR technologies as well as the skills needed for a successful career in XR software development. This talk will be geared towards students interested in pursuing a career in XR; however it may also be beneficial to all computer science students in general. More details will be posted to Discord and TerpLink soon.
 

COVID-19 GUIDELINES
Please note that as per University guidelines, all attendees of our events and activities will be required to wear N95 or KN95 masks. Violators will be denied entry into our events/activities. Additionally, all of our members are encouraged to familiarize themselves with the University's latest COVID-19 Guidelines and take appropriate actions as necessary.

EXTERNAL XR-RELATED EVENTS

THE SECOND GREAT WAVE OF HUMAN-ORIENTED COMPUTING WITH MICHAEL ABRASH
The UMD Department of Computer Science has invited Michael Abrash, Chief Scientist of Meta's Reality Labs, to host a guest lecture on Tuesday, March 8th at 3:30 PM in IRB 4105 and on Zoom. Join as he discusses the current state of extended reality and the technological advances needed to push XR to the mainstream and into a new computing age. To join via Zoom, please use the following link: https://umd.zoom.us/j/94021557450?pwd=eDNPaFdWU3ZSV2ZUNGp1Nno1UnFKdz09
 

IMD SEMINAR SERIES: A CONVERSATION WITH JOSEPH CATHEY
Join this intimate "fireside chat" on Wednesday, March 3rd at 6:00 PM in IRB 1207 with Chief Experience Officer and Founder of Capitol Interactive, Joey Cathey! Learn about Capitols Interactive's work in augmented and virtual reality (XR), how Joseph got into the field and started his own business, and get insights on the many exciting opportunities for designers and developers starting out in XR.
 

BUILD AN AR ROBOT ASSISTANT IN UNITY
Circuit Stream is hosting a AR workshop on Thursday, March 10th at 3:00 PM. In this free AR workshop, They will teach you how to make an AR Robot using Unity game development software. The robot you'll build will use plane tracking and move around the room using sensors. For a cherry on the top, we'll also show you how to control your robot by using your smartphone and joystick controls. This workshop is free and doesn't assume any pre-existing knowledge. You won't need an AR/VR device rather than your smartphone. By the end of the workshop you will know how to build your own simple AR projects in Unity. More details and registration can be found at: https://circuitstream.com/workshop/ar-robot-assistant-in-unity/.

XR IN THE NEWS

How Virtual Reality Is Expanding Health Care | TIME

When Your Boss Becomes a Hologram | Bloomberg

The metaverse stole the show at the world’s biggest mobile event — and things got weird | CNBC

Find a cool article you’d like to share with other members of the club? Post it in the Discord server for a chance to have it featured in next week’s newsletter!

item.title: The XREPORT | Week of 02/27/2022
item.description:
View this email in your browser
THE XREPORT
February 27, 2022

THIS WEEK'S TOPICS

Intro to VR Development (Part I) Workshop — Projects Kickoff —Last Week Recap
Students playing Beat Saber at our Tournament last week

XR CLUB NEWS AND EVENTS

LAST WEEK RECAP
Last Tuesday we hosted the second episode of our "Introduction to Unity" workshop series. Attendees were able where able to add key mechanics to their Zombie Fighter game while learning more about the Unity physics system! If you missed it, please make sure to check the Discord for a recap and recording. Last Friday, we also had an amazing turn-out at our Beat Saber Tournament. Hope everyone had a great time and we look forward to hosting similar fun events this semester!
 

WORKSHOP: INTRO TO VR DEVELOPMENT (PART I)
We'll be hosting the first part of our Intro to VR Development workshop series on Tuesday, March 1st at 6:30 PM in CSI 2117. In this first episode of the workshop series, you will begin to create your own Beat Saber clone: Bleat Shaver! Throughout that process, you'll learn how to configure a Unity project for VR, enable HMD and controller tracking in your scene, and build and deploy your apps to the Oculus Quest 2 headset. We will have a limited number of headsets for participants to share, but feel free to bring your own Quest if you have one. Additionally, please make sure that you have Unity 2021.2 (or higher) along with the Android Build Support module (and its OpenJDK + Android SDK/NDK dependencies) installed prior to coming to the workshop. More details can be found at https://terplink.umd.edu/event/7949013.
 

PROJECTS KICKOFF
Join us this Friday, March 4th at 5:00 PM in IRB 0110 as we take the first step towards creating our own amazing XR experiences! At our Brainstorm Night a few weeks ago, you all came up with some incredible ideas, and it is now time to decide on the projects we will pursue for this semester. If you are interested in working on a project, please review the project descriptions and submit the Project Selection Poll by this Thursday! At the kickoff, we will announce the most popular project ideas, and you will have the chance to meet your team members and a formulate a plan for success! More details can be found at https://terplink.umd.edu/event/7951664.
 

COVID-19 GUIDELINES
Please note that as per University guidelines, all attendees of our events and activities will be required to wear N95 or KN95 masks. Violators will be denied entry into our events/activities. Additionally, all of our members are encouraged to familiarize themselves with the University's latest COVID-19 Guidelines and take appropriate actions as necessary.

EXTERNAL XR-RELATED EVENTS

FIND YOUR XR DREAM JOB!
This event will take place on Tuesday, March 1st at 7:00 PM and is a celebration of a comprehensive map of XR companies and job opportunities! Several major industry partners collaborated to make this resource a reality, and it is finally ready to be shared with the world! There will be a panel of startup executives to discuss their experience building XR companies. As well as breakout sessions with startups and large companies to discuss career opportunities. More details and registration can be found here: https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_BfebgtFwQiW-ikFDgmEPGA
 

MIT REALITY HACK HACKATHON
Reality Hack, MIT's XR hackathon, will be taking place during our spring break from March 23rd to 27th. This is an annual community-run XR hackathon comprising thought leaders, brand mentors and creators, participants, students, and technology lovers, who come together and attend tech workshops, talks, discussions, fireside chats, collaborations, hacking, and more. At their last Hack in 2020, 75 teams created incredible projects including climate change visualizations in VR, AR storyboarding tools, spatialized hashtags, VR accessibility toolkits, VR games and more! Applications are due by Tuesday, March 1st. More details can be found at: https://www.mitrealityhack.com/.
 

XRSI PRIVACY & SAFTEY FRAMEWORK
The XRSI is hosting a kick-off event on Tuesday, March 1st at 12:30 PM, where they will set the agenda and share the logistical information for continued research and development of version 2 of their own privacy and safety framework for immersive technologies, The framework is a free, globally accessible baseline rulebook built by bringing together a diverse set of experts from various backgrounds and domains, including privacy and cybersecurity, cloud computing, immersive technologies, artificial intelligence, legal, artists, product design, engineering, and many more. More details can be found at: https://xrsi.org/the-xrsi-privacy-and-safety-framework-2 

XR IN THE NEWS

Meta filed a patent for ‘3D conversations’ — are holographic calls almost here? | The Next Web

Watch Mark Zuckerberg’s Metaverse AI Presentation in Less Than 10 Minutes | CNET

I went to a metaverse recruitment fair with 30 companies and 200 attendees... | Business Insider

Find a cool article you’d like to share with other members of the club? Post it in the Discord server for a chance to have it featured in next week’s newsletter!
Copyright © 2022 XR Club, All rights reserved.
